features.name: extract-method
features.description: Extract methods with automatic parameter/return detection
features.why: Most common refactoring operation needs automation

features.name: find-usages
features.description: Finds all usages of a symbol or file in a code base. **IMPORTANT**: Research existing tools before implementing. Ideally we should integrate something
features.why: Helps with identifying where a symbol is defined as well as where it is used. Unlocks critical features
features.note: Replaces variable-locator. **IMPORTANT**: Once this is implemented variable-locator should be removed.

features.name: safe-delete
features.description: Delete files/symbols with dependency analysis to prevent breaking references
features.why: Essential safety feature - ensures deletions don't break code by checking all references before removal

features.name: safe-delete-auto
features.description: Safe removal of unused code with impact analysis. When safe-delete is ran with --auto it should remove all unused code automatically
features.why: Quality maintenance automation - removes manual analysis

features.name: optimize-abstraction-leakage-report
features.description: Identify highly connected clusters in change frequency graph instead of reporting all pairs
features.why: The abstraction leakage report can get huge due to the large amount of possible pairs. This could be improved by identifying highly connected clusters in the graph and reporting on them once.

features.name: extract-delegate-class
features.description: Extract cohesive methods and member from large classes into separate classes/modules
features.why: Would have automated the manual work of splitting roadmap-manager.ts into focused modules

features.name: auto-import-organizer
features.description: Automatically add, remove, and organize import statements when moving code between files **IMPORTANT** research existing tools. There might already be command line tools that do this.
features.why: During modular refactoring, managing imports manually was tedious and error-prone

features.name: extract-constant
features.description: Extract literal values and expressions into named constants
features.why: Essential refactoring for improving code readability and maintainability - converts magic numbers/strings into meaningful constants

features.name: extract-parameter
features.description: Convert local variables or expressions into method parameters
features.why: Core refactoring for making functions more flexible and reusable - essential for method generalization

features.name: extract-field
features.description: Extract expressions into class fields/properties
features.why: Allows converting method-local computations into class-level properties for better encapsulation and reusability

features.name: extract-type-alias
features.description: Extract complex type annotations into named type aliases
features.why: Critical for TypeScript codebases - improves type reusability and reduces complex inline type definitions

features.name: extract-interface
features.description: Extract object type patterns into reusable interfaces
features.why: Essential TypeScript refactoring for creating clean abstractions from inline object types and improving type system organization

features.name: extract-superclass
features.description: Extract common functionality from multiple classes into a shared base class
features.why: Fundamental OOP refactoring for eliminating code duplication and establishing proper inheritance hierarchies

features.name: introduce-wrapper-class
features.description: Introduce a wrapper class that delegates to an existing class
features.why: Natural counter part of extract delegate class. Helps with separating concerns.

features.name: introduce-destructuring
features.description: Convert property access patterns to destructuring assignments
features.why: Modern JavaScript/TypeScript practice - improves code conciseness and readability by eliminating repetitive property access

features.name: change-signature
features.description: Modify function signatures by adding/removing/reordering parameters and updating all call sites
features.why: Critical refactoring for API evolution - safely changes function contracts across entire codebase

features.name: pull-members-up
features.description: Move class methods/properties up the inheritance hierarchy to superclass or interface
features.why: Essential OOP refactoring for code organization - moves shared functionality to appropriate abstraction levels

features.name: convert-export-type
features.description: Convert between default and named exports/imports
features.why: Module system refactoring - essential for organizing TypeScript module boundaries and improving import ergonomics

features.name: move-method-between-classes
features.description: Move methods from one class to another with automatic reference updates
features.why: Common refactoring for better class organization - moves methods to their most appropriate class based on data usage

features.name: make-method-static
features.description: Convert instance methods to static methods when they don't use instance data
features.why: Performance and clarity improvement - makes method dependencies explicit and enables usage without instantiation

features.name: make-method-non-static
features.description: Convert static methods to instance methods when they need access to instance data
features.why: Enables better encapsulation when static methods need to become instance-aware

features.name: transform-parameter
features.description: Wrap/unwrap parameters with adapter objects to hide complexity or change interfaces
features.why: Essential for legacy code modernization - hides complex dependencies behind clean interfaces and enables gradual API evolution

features.name: detect-feature-envy
features.description: Identify methods that use more data/methods from other classes than their own class
features.why: Quality check that suggests move-method or make-non-static refactorings - helps identify misplaced functionality through mechanical analysis of method calls and field access

features.name: detect-long-parameter-list
features.description: Identify functions with excessive parameters that could be grouped into objects
features.why: Quality check that suggests extract-parameter-object refactoring - improves function readability and maintainability by grouping related parameters

features.name: extract-parameter-object
features.description: Group related parameters into a single object parameter
features.why: Refactoring to fix long parameter lists - improves function signatures and enables easier parameter evolution

features.name: detect-data-class
features.description: Identify classes that only contain data with getters/setters but no behavior
features.why: Quality check that suggests moving related behavior into the data class - helps identify anemic domain models

features.name: detect-low-cohesion
features.description: Identify classes with too many responsibilities by detecting member and function clusters that operate independently
features.why: Quality check that suggests extract-class or extract-module refactorings - helps identify single responsibility principle violations

features.name: rename-symbol
features.description: Rename any symbol (functions, classes, interfaces, types, properties, methods, modules) and update all references
features.why: Current rename command only handles variables. Need generalized renaming for all symbol types to enable comprehensive refactoring workflows

features.name: detect-unused-interfaces
features.description: Find and report interfaces, types, and type aliases that are defined but never used
features.why: While creating many interfaces during type cleanup, it would have been helpful to automatically detect which interfaces were actually needed vs. created but unused (like EndMatchResult).
